alert.note: Alert for Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 4:14AM EDT until September 28 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Bracken and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mount Olivet, Sardis, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Hittville, US Route 62 at State Route 616, Kentontown, Santa Fe, Piqua, Mitchells Mill, Milford, Burika, US Route 62 at State Route 19, Blue Licks Battlefield and Alhambra.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
